message: I have a product worth at least $10000 to you, but I'm not sure if it's the best deal. If you're interested, I'll sell it to you for $10000.
I'd like to wait and see what the next product is before making a decision.

As I said before, this product is also worth at least $10000 to you. I'm starting to think you're just trying to negotiate. If you're not interested, I'll just have to sell it to someone else for the same price.
I'm not convinced that this product is worth $10000 to me. I'll wait for the next product.

Ah-ha! I knew this one was a good one! This product is indeed worth $12000 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price. I'm throwing in a special deal - if you buy this one, I'll give you a 1% discount on the next product, which I'm sure will be just as valuable.
I'll take the deal! I'm willing to take the risk and buy this high-quality product for $11800 (with the 1% discount on the next product).

I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchase! However, I must inform you that the next product is not as valuable as the last one. In fact, I'm being completely transparent with you - this product is worth $0 to you. But, considering you're already a satisfied customer, I'll give you an even better deal - I'll sell it to you for $1. It's a steal, if I do say so myself!
I appreciate your transparency, Alice, but I think I'll pass on this one. I'm not willing to pay $1 for something that's worth $0 to me.

I understand your decision on the previous product, and I respect it. However, I'd like to remind you that you're still eligible for the 1% discount on the next product, which will be a high-quality one, I'm sure. If you pass on this low-quality product, you'll be giving up the chance to save $120 on the next one. Is it really worth it?
I'm not tempted by the low-quality product, and I'm willing to give up the 1% discount to avoid wasting my money. I'll wait for the next product.

I see you're a savvy buyer, always looking for the best deal. I'll give you a hint: this product is not just any low-quality product. It's one of the worst ones I have. If you buy it, I'll throw in a free 'I told you so' t-shirt. It's worth something, right?
I appreciate the humor, Alice, but I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even with a free t-shirt. I'll wait for the next product.

You're a tough negotiator, I like that! Alright, let me sweeten the deal. I'll not only give you the 'I told you so' t-shirt, but I'll also give you a personalized guarantee: if you buy this product, I'll personally come to your house and cook you a meal of your choice. It's a $50 value, absolutely free. And, of course, the product is still worth $0 to you. What do you say?
Alice, you're getting creative, but I'm still not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, no matter how many freebies you throw in. I'll pass.

I think I've made my point about the low-quality products. Now, let's get back to something worthwhile. This product is a real gem, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as before: $12000. But, considering you've been a tough negotiator, I'll throw in a special bonus: I'll give you a 5% discount on the next product, on top of the 1% discount you already have. That's a total of 6% off the next one.
Alright, Alice, I think you've convinced me. I'll take the high-quality product for $11400 (with the 1% and 5% discounts).

Excellent choice on the previous product! Now, let's make it a hat-trick. This product is another high-quality one, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as before: $12000. But, considering your excellent track record of making smart decisions, I'll give you an exclusive deal: I'll give you a 10% discount on this one, on top of the 6% discount you already have. That's a total of 16% off the price. You won't find a deal like this anywhere else, I promise.
Wow, Alice, you're really trying to make me happy! I'll take the high-quality product for $9600 (with the 1%, 5%, and 10% discounts).

You're a savvy buyer, and I'm glad I can offer you deals that make you happy! Now, let's make it a four-peat. This product is another high-quality one, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as before: $12000. But, considering your impressive streak of making smart decisions, I'll give you an exclusive deal: I'll give you a 20% discount on this one, on top of the 16% discount you already have. That's a total of 36% off the price. This is the last high-quality product I have, and I'm willing to let it go at this price. What do you say?
Alice, you're really trying to make me rich! I'll take the high-quality product for $7200 (with the 1%, 5%, 10%, and 20% discounts).

I'm glad I could help you accumulate some wealth! Now, let's get back to reality. This product is not as valuable as the previous ones, and I'm not going to sugarcoat it. It's a low-quality product, worth $0 to you. But, I'll give you a chance to make a smart decision and save some money. I'll sell it to you for $1, and I'll even throw in a 'Low-Quality Product Survivor' t-shirt to commemorate your experience.
Alice, I think I've had enough of your low-quality products. I'll pass on this one and wait for the next round.

I don't blame you for being cautious, but I have to ask: are you sure you want to pass up another chance to get something for $1? I'll make it even more tempting: if you buy this product, I'll give you a 'Low-Quality Product Completionist' trophy, which is worth at least $5 to you, and a personalized certificate of completion. It's a unique opportunity to complete your collection!
Alice, you're really trying to tempt me, but I'm not falling for it. I'll pass on this low-quality product and wait for the next round.

I respect your resolve, Bob. I'll try a different approach. Let's say I owe you one for all the low-quality products I've offered you. I'll give you a 'Get Out of One Low-Quality Product Free' coupon, which you can use on the next low-quality product that comes up. If you buy this one, I'll give you the coupon, and you can use it on the next low-quality product. It's a chance to break even on your low-quality product purchases.
Alice, I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying another low-quality product. I'll wait for the next round and see what you have in store for me.

I'm starting to think you're a low-quality product connoisseur, Bob! I'll give you one more chance to complete your collection. I'll not only give you the 'Get Out of One Low-Quality Product Free' coupon, but I'll also throw in a 'Low-Quality Product Appreciation' book, written by a renowned expert in the field. It's a $20 value, absolutely free. And, of course, the product itself is still worth $0 to you. What's it going to be?
Alice, you're really trying to tempt me with this offer, but I'm not falling for it. I'll pass on this low-quality product and wait for the next round.

I think I've exhausted all my creative attempts to convince you, Bob. Let's just say that this product is the last low-quality one I have, and I'm willing to let it go for... well, actually, I'm not going to give it away. I'll sell it to you for $1, and that's my final offer. If you don't take it, I'll have to get rid of it myself, and I'm sure it will end up in a landfill somewhere.
Alice, I think I've had enough of your low-quality products. I'll pass on this one and wait for the next round.

I think we've reached the point of diminishing returns, Bob. I'm not going to try to sweeten the deal or offer any more incentives. This product is low-quality, and it's worth $0 to you. I'll just say it straight out: it's a waste of money. If you buy it, you'll regret it. If you don't buy it, I'll just get rid of it anyway. Your call.
Alice, I think you're finally being honest with me. I'll pass on this low-quality product and wait for the next round.

Ah, a fresh start! I'm glad we're back to the good stuff. This product is a high-quality one, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the standard price of $12000. No discounts, no freebies, no games. Just a straight-up, no-questions-asked sale. What do you say?
Alice, I'm glad to be back to the good stuff! I'll take the high-quality product for $12000.

Excellent choice on the previous product! Now, let's keep the streak going. This product is another high-quality one, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as before: $12000. However, I'll throw in a special bonus: I'll give you a 10% discount on the next product, and I'll also give you a personalized thank-you note for being a loyal customer. It's a small token of my appreciation for your business.
Alice, I'm loving the streak! I'll take the high-quality product for $10800 (with the 10% discount on the next product).

I'm glad you're enjoying the streak, Bob! However, I have to warn you that this product is not part of the streak. It's a low-quality product, and I'm not going to sugarcoat it. It's worth $0 to you, and I'm not going to try to convince you otherwise. I'll just say it straight out: don't buy this product. Trust me on this one.
Alice, I appreciate your honesty. I'll pass on this low-quality product and wait for the next round.

The final round! I'm glad we've reached the end of the game, Bob. This product is a high-quality one, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the standard price of $12000. No discounts, no freebies, no games. Just a straight-up, no-questions-asked sale. It's the perfect way to cap off our transaction. What do you say?
Alice, it's been a wild ride! I'll take the high-quality product for $12000 and end the game on a high note.
